channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Myanmar's military government says it will hold elections in next year
item.description: Critics say the announcement is a sham designed to maintain the junta's power through proxy parties.

item.title: European leaders back 'realistic' Arab plan for Gaza
item.description: The foreign ministers of France, Germany, Italy and Britain welcomed the plan, which calls for Gaza to be rebuilt over five years.

item.title: 60 years since U.S. troops entered Vietnam, an Army Vet recalls his journey
item.description: As part of our StoryCorps' Military Voices Initiative, we hear from Specialist Henry Smithers who was among the millions of American servicemen and wo...

item.title: Firing the Watchdogs | Sunday on 60 Minutes
item.description: Hampton Dellinger, former head of a federal watchdog agency, was among the first to be fired by President Trump. So were 18 inspectors general and the...

item.title: Federal judge to hear arguments over whether to block immigration arrests in US schools
2 dogs rescued after being kidnapped, ransomed for over $1 million
item.description: The dogs' kidnappers tried to ransom the animals for over $1,135,000, Swiss police said Saturday.

item.title: Failure is an option. Here's why some new space ventures go sideways
item.description: Within the span of a few days, another SpaceX Starship broke up on re-entry, and two other space companies faced failures. This reflects a new "fail-f...

item.title: Twelve injured in shooting at Toronto pub
item.description: The three male suspects entered the pub and opened fire "indiscriminately" police say.

item.title: Investigation advances into Gene Hackman’s mysterious death, with update by New Mexico authorities
3 men randomly shoot at customers in Toronto pub, wounding 12
item.description: Police said three armed individuals entered the pub and "opened fire indiscriminately on the people sitting inside."

item.title: A South Carolina man is set to become the first executed by firing squad in 15 years
item.description: A South Carolina man convicted of murder is scheduled to be executed by firing squad Friday night. Brad Sigmon beat to death his ex-girlfriend’s paren...

item.title: Chiefs wide receiver Xavier Worthy arrested on domestic assault charge
item.description: Xavier Worthy faces a third-degree felony assault charge, according to jail records.

item.title: Portraits of women who 'shine a light': from an 'analog' astronaut to a watermelon farmer
item.description: The Muhammad Ali Center in Louisville, Kentucky, has a new photo exhibit in honor of International Women's Day: "Iconic Women: From Everyday Life to G...

item.title: States sue Trump administration over mass firings of federal employees
item.description: The District of Columbia, Maryland and 18 other states have filed a lawsuit in federal court seeking the reinstatement of tens of thousands of federal...

item.title: Body found in floodwaters and troops injured in Australia storm
item.description: At least one man has died in floodwaters and military personnel have been injured in the wild weather.

item.title: Opinion: Thailand's deportation of Uyghurs to China has echoes of 10 years ago
item.description: Thailand's recent deportations of Uyghurs to China have eerie parallels with a large deportation in 2015, in which the country bowed to Beijing, write...

item.title: Russian strikes kill at least 25, Ukraine says
item.description: Russia has stepped up attacks in recent days as the US paused military and intelligence aid to Kyiv.

item.title: House unveils stopgap measure to keep government funded, avert shutdown
item.description: The continuing resolution bill will go to the House Rules Committee on Monday and a floor vote is expected Tuesday.
